target_markets.market_description: Entrepreneurs and high-performers seeking emotional regulation and sustainable success

problems_validated.problem: People experience extreme emotional swings that negatively impact their performance and well-being
problems_validated.severity: High - affects decision-making and long-term success
problems_validated.current_solutions: Drugs, alcohol, stimuli for temporary highs
problems_validated.market_gap: Current solutions create equal and opposite negative reactions

business_strategies.strategy: Emotional amplitude reduction - maintaining consistent emotional baseline
business_strategies.implementation: Avoid extreme highs and lows, practice emotional regulation
business_strategies.case_study: Most impressive people in the world maintain tight emotional bands

problems_solutions.problem: Emotional volatility and extreme mood swings affecting performance
problems_solutions.solution: Reduce emotional amplitude by avoiding extreme stimuli and practicing baseline maintenance

mistakes_to_avoid.mistake: Seeking artificial highs through drugs, alcohol, or excessive stimuli
mistakes_to_avoid.consequences: Equal and opposite negative reaction - if you go to +8, you'll go to -8
mistakes_to_avoid.prevention: Accept baseline emotions and avoid artificial stimulation
mistakes_to_avoid.example: MDMA taking you to +8 happiness results in -8 for days after

metrics_kpis.optimization_tip: Reduce extreme stimuli and practice emotional regulation

trends_signals.trend: Focus on emotional regulation and sustainable performance over quick highs
trends_signals.opportunity: Tools and services for emotional regulation and sustainable success

actionable_quotes.quote: if you're an elastic band and um you know drugs alcohol um stimuli that's you pulling up on the elastic band right but the cost is going to be whatever the equal reaction is on the other side
actionable_quotes.context: Explaining the concept of emotional highs and lows
actionable_quotes.actionability: Avoid artificial stimuli that create temporary highs

actionable_quotes.quote: the most impressive people in the world like find a way to just reduce the amplitude like they never get too high they never get too low
actionable_quotes.actionability: Focus on maintaining emotional stability rather than chasing highs

actionable_quotes.quote: buying yourself happiness or selling yourself future sadness
actionable_quotes.context: Describing the trade-off of artificial stimulation
actionable_quotes.actionability: Consider long-term emotional costs of short-term pleasure

key_statistics.statistic: If you go to +8 with stimuli, you'll go to -8 afterward
key_statistics.context: Elastic band theory of emotional regulation

key_statistics.statistic: Boredom at -2 or -3 can lead to +3 or +4 rebound
key_statistics.context: Natural emotional recovery from allowing baseline states

meta.title: Buying Happiness or Selling Sadness | Andrew Wilkinson
